item.description: My wife has a voice made for podcasting. I’m editing the newest episode of Sap.py (!) and listening to her speak is simply sublime.
item.dc:creator: Chris Krycho

item.description: Quote of the week (3-year-old Ellie talking to her mom, who has been learning Python): “Mommy! I have a function for you!”
item.dc:creator: Chris Krycho

item.description: Hooked up my digital piano to Logic Pro X tonight and wrote the theme for a podcast we’re doing together on learning to program. It’s so good!
item.dc:creator: Chris Krycho

item.description: My dear wife has started teaching herself Python as a hobby. She has the essential skill required to succeed as a programmer: the willingness to persevere even when it isn’t making sense to her. I’m extremely impressed.
item.dc:creator: Chris Krycho

item.title: Snow Days and Friends Moving
item.description:
Another month gone, another bunch of little changes, and a few bigger changes, too.

February marked the final burst of winter here. We had a number of days of wintry weather, leading to several days where Southeastern’s campus was closed—though none on days when I had class! One …
item.dc:creator: Chris Krycho

item.title: The State of Our Family in Early 2015
item.description: It has been a long time since I wrote a family update here, and I skipped the Christmas letter this year because I was exhausted. I resolved at the beginning of the year to write at least one update every month, though. I want these updates here for myself, if …
item.dc:creator: Chris Krycho
